column5: I slipped away from work this afternoon and was on the ice fishing by 2pm. Walked out to 110 fow and set up shop. Fish regularly showed up on the radar and took a look at my lures but I didn't hook into a fish until 3:30pm. A little 16" grabbed my Jigging Shadrap. Snapped a pic and sent it back down.    About 20 min later this fatty chased up after a Williams gold/silver. Being too small to feed a family of six I sent him on his way also.    The action died so I moved into 95 fow. The sun went down and I was cursing the fact that I let dinner go.  I had about 4 hits that I had missed on a 4 inch tube so I down sized to a 3 inch to see if that would get a fish to suck it in better. As daylight was fading I looked to the shoreline to make sure I knew were I was heading to get off the ice. Just then a Laker hammered the tube almost taking the rod from my hand. After a short battle I iced dinner, a sweet 26".    For once Lady Simcoe blessed my efforts. It usually takes me all winter to catch 3 trout through the ice.  It is nice to get that monkey off my back so soon in the season.
Nice job skud
Nice job Doug!
Niiiiiiice Lakers dude  How do you do on thos jiggin raps?
Sweet looking laker!  How thick is the ice in that area?
Looks like a decent day. I'm planning on heading up tomorrow morning. Probably IBP to start than if lucky on whities on to BBP for lakers.
hey skud i was the guy in flip over frabil walked past you around sun set . you did well nice pics
Very nice, skud, three fine fresh fish, but that last one was a beauty! You have four kids?  How do you find time to fish and hunt?

Nice lakers Skud!  Well, I'll be giving Lady Simcoe a try tommorrow, most likely for whities off IBP. I've tried a number of times with other friends on KBay only to be the only one skunked for lakers! Lady S has my number, one of these days I'll hook up with a laker. Hopefully, this year.
nice report! any machines out there?
nice going

archie_james_c : The jigging Shadraps have produced for me almost every time. A top 3 lure for me now.  Shore Lunch : The ice is 6-8 inches.  Phil65 : A pleasure meeting you.  douG :  As my post stated, I have to 'slip away'.  HearingFish : Simcoe had my # for many, many years. I hope to keep my success going.  Cityfisher : There are very few machines out there. 99% of the fishermen are playing it safe and walking.  Thanks for the comments all.
You're killing me here Skud, I can't wait to get out there.  Nice job man.  Joey
Great report skud...hopefully I'll bump into you over the winter....I'll just look for the guy icing all the trout!
Some nice fish you caught there Doug.  Good on ya!

Nice work Skud...i was simalarly thinking i let supper go the other dsy too, but i got a couple 18-20" right at the end....not had one as nice as your supper yet though this year...great report. I also am lovin' the shad raps this year.
Hey Doug, Way to go, I was out at Shanty and only managed a Cisco. Still waiting for my first laker or whitie of the season. Nice to see some one is doing well, Keep it up, Ry.
Hijack in 3, 2, 1...  hahaha!  Great report man!  Nice laker!  My dad... lol...  Yeah and family of6 doesnt' mean he's got 4 kids, he may have 5 wives and no kids
Yeah he's killing me too. If he can get 'em well hell I know I can.
Congrats Skud on getting that monkey off your back Great job and that last trout is a beauty Thanks for sharing Leechman
